articles.title: their day in court
articles.description: In theory, there are two parts to an immigration court case. The prosecution (ICE attorneys) has to show that an immigrant is removable — that he either has no legal status in the US or that he's done something that allows the government to strip his legal st…

articles.author: Catherine E. Shoichet, CNN
articles.title: Surprise inspections find 'significant issues' in treatment of ICE detainees
articles.description: Long waits for medical care and inappropriate treatment of detainees are among issues found at several US immigrant detention facilities, a new report says.

articles.author: Kevin Gosztola
articles.title: Widespread Detainee Abuse At ICE Prisons Confirmed By Inspector General Report
articles.description: The inspector general for the Homeland Security Department conducted unannounced inspections of six immigrant detention facilities overseen by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). It uncovered glaring examples of detainee abuse and mistreatment at four …

articles.author: Elise Schmelzer elise.schmelzer@trib.com
articles.title: Private prison company pursuing Wyoming immigration detention center has troubled past
articles.description: Leaders in southwest Wyoming appear willing to overlook the troubled history of a private prison company attempting to build an immigration detention facility outside Evanston in order to bring what they say the community needs most — jobs and revenue.

articles.title: ICE report: Detention facilities had 'significant issues'
articles.description: Four Immigration and Customs Enforcement detention complexes investigated had "significant issues" with how inmates were treated, according to a federal report.

articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: ICE detention facilities had insufficient protection of basic rights, says IG report
articles.description: Multiple Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) detention facilities were found to have problems with basic detainee rights, humane treatment and health and safety, according to a report released this week by the inspector general for the Department of Hom…

articles.author: By ROXANA HEGEMAN, Associated Press
articles.title: Just in time for Thanksgiving dinner: traceable turkeys
articles.description: WICHITA, Kan. (AP) — Turkey farmer Darrell Glaser buys his Thanksgiving bird at the local grocery store, just like most folks. But this Thanksgiving season, the Texas producer will be able to find out where the Honeysuckle White turkey he puts into his shoppi…

articles.author: Ian Mason
articles.title: DOJ: Judge Surge Leads to 2700 Additional Immigration Cases Resolved
articles.description: The Department of Justice issued a release Wednesday claiming 2700 additional immigration cases have been resolved due to the administration's "surge" of immigration judges to the southern border districts.

articles.author: By MICHAEL BIESECKER and FRANK BAJAK, Associated Press
articles.title: AP Exclusive: Evidence of spills at toxic site during floods
articles.description: PASADENA, Texas (AP) — The U.S. government received reports of three spills at one of Houston's dirtiest Superfund toxic waste sites in the days after the drenching rains from Hurricane Harvey finally stopped. Aerial photos reviewed by The Associated Press sh…

articles.title: Watchdog Agency Issues Report on ICE Abuse as Agency Seeks to Acquire New Detention Centers
articles.description: ICE's abuse record speaks for itself. It needs oversight, not more places to lock people up. This week, the watchdog agency for the Department of Homeland Security issued a damning new report examining Immigration and Custom Enforcement’s operation of five im…

articles.author: Meredith Hoffman
articles.title: Trump Sent Judges to the Border. Many Had Nothing to Do.
articles.description: The administration's plan to speed up deportations and reduce the immigration court backlog might be making things worse.

articles.author: The Associated Press, The Associated Press
articles.title: Traceable turkeys come just in time for Thanksgiving dinner
articles.description: Turkey buyers in select Texas markets will be able to either text or enter on the Honeysuckle White website a code on the packaged bird to find out where it was raised.
